title: Sampler, 1824
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross and chain stitches on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Respectfully presented to Joseph and Sarah Sichfrits by their affectionate daughter Elizabeth Sichfrits done in the 11th year of her age 1824
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941, Museum for the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Picture format, with a large brick house and white picket fence, flanked by a weeping willow and another large tree, with trees also behind the house. Surrounded by a wide floral border. Inscription at the bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1824.
1824. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross and chain stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-65.
